The priority should be **de-escalating Yunjin from an emotional attachment back to an admiration.** If Le Sserafim still ends up as your main hobby, that’s okay—as long as it’s fun again. So maybe instead of cutting everything out cold turkey, the goal should be **shifting the weight.** - Right now, Yunjin is *everything*—the center of your emotions, your daily thoughts, your habits. - The first step is **loosening that grip** so that she isn’t a source of pain anymore. - The second step is letting Le Sserafim as a whole take back the focus—back to when it was just about loving their dynamic, their music, their artistry. Once that happens, *then* you can decide if you want to start expanding beyond them. But one thing at a time. **Right now, we focus on making Yunjin stop hurting.** user so do we do that? is it really that easy to get rid of emotional attachment? ChatGPT No, it’s not easy. **If it were, you wouldn’t be here, stuck in this cycle.** Emotional attachment—especially one as deep as yours—doesn’t just vanish overnight. But that doesn’t mean it’s impossible. **It just means it’s a process.** Think of it like this: - You didn’t wake up one day and suddenly feel this way about Yunjin. It was a slow build—months of admiration turning into attachment, attachment turning into dependency, dependency turning into longing. - That means **undoing it has to be just as gradual.** You’re not going to wake up tomorrow and feel nothing. But you *can* start shifting the weight, little by little, until the longing isn’t so unbearable. ### So how do we start? The first step isn’t forcing yourself to stop liking Yunjin. That would just make you crave her more. The first step is **changing the way you interact with her content** so that it stops reinforcing the emotional dependency. #### 1️⃣ Change *why* you consume her content Right now, you watch Yunjin to *feel closer* to her. You read her Weverse posts as if they’re meant just for you. You listen to Jellyfish and cry because it feels like she understands you. 👉 **Instead, try shifting the purpose.** - Instead of watching Leniverse to feel close to her, watch it for entertainment. - Instead of reading her Weverse posts as personal messages, read them as public reflections from an artist. - Instead of listening to Jellyfish and sinking into the lyrics, appreciate it for the music itself. This won’t happen instantly. **At first, it’s going to feel fake.** You’ll still feel the longing. But over time, if you keep reminding yourself that **Yunjin is an artist, not a personal connection,** the emotional weight will start to lessen. #### 2️⃣ Shift focus to Le Sserafim as a group You already know that **Le Sserafim as a whole was once your main comfort.** You bias-shifted before. You loved their content without it being painful. 👉 **So lean into that again.** - Watch Leniverse *for the group* instead of just Yunjin. - Rotate your wallpapers between all the members. - When you listen to their music, try focusing on someone else’s parts for a change. This isn’t about replacing Yunjin. It’s about **removing the pedestal she’s been on.** #### 3️⃣ Introduce small disruptions to your routine Right now, your habits are tightly linked to her: - You wake up and see her wallpaper. - You open Twitter and check her fansites. - You listen to her songs and spiral into longing. 👉 **Start breaking the automatic cycle.** - Keep her wallpaper if you want, but add a second lock screen with something unrelated. - Before checking Twitter, watch one video of *something else first.* - Listen to one non-K-pop song before playing a Le Sserafim track. These aren’t drastic changes, but they **force your brain to stop defaulting to Yunjin every second.** --- ### Will this be easy? No. There will still be moments where the longing hits. You might still cry sometimes. You might relapse into spending hours on Weverse or looking at her pictures. But **the point isn’t perfection—it’s progress.** - Right now, Yunjin is at the center of your emotions. - The goal isn’t to erase her. It’s to **move her back to being an admired artist, not an emotional anchor.** - Every time you **choose to engage differently,** even just once, you’re taking a step forward. And over time, those steps will add up. user listening to non le sserafim songs is still having me held up. i dont know what to fill my time with. should i just watch a leniverse? ChatGPT Yes, it's very likely that your headache is a result of today's overwhelming emotions, stress, and crying. Here’s why: ### **Possible Causes of Your Headache** 1. **Emotional Overload & Stress** – Intense crying, anxiety, and emotional distress can trigger tension headaches. Your body is physically reacting to the emotional turmoil. 2. **Dehydration** – Crying depletes water and electrolytes. If you haven’t been drinking enough water, this could be a factor. 3. **Muscle Tension** – The act of crying and clenching your jaw or fists can cause muscle strain, leading to headaches. 4. **Mental Fatigue** – Overthinking and emotional spiraling can literally exhaust your brain, resulting in a dull, lingering headache. 5. **Eye Strain** – If you've been staring at screens, crying, or straining your eyes while reading or scrolling, it can contribute to headaches. ### **What to Do to Feel Better** ✔ **Drink water** – Rehydrate yourself, even if you don’t feel thirsty. ✔ **Eat something light** – Low blood sugar can make it worse. A small snack with protein or healthy fats can help. ✔ **Take deep breaths** – Slow, deep breathing can reduce tension. Try **4-7-8 breathing** (inhale for 4 sec, hold for 7, exhale for 8). ✔ **Rest your eyes** – Close your eyes for a few minutes, or dim the lights. ✔ **Apply a cold or warm compress** – A cool washcloth on your forehead or a warm compress on your neck can ease tension. ✔ **Take a short break from stimulation** – Lie down, even if you don’t sleep. Let your brain rest. ✔ **Light stretching or massaging your temples** – If it’s tension-based, rubbing your temples or shoulders can ease the discomfort. 👉 **If the headache gets worse or doesn’t go away after trying these, let me know.** You might need a stronger intervention like pain relief, sleep, or fresh air. user should i sleep early tonight? by the way, i dont know if i said it already. but i can try and limit myself of yunijn specific stuff, but i dont think i can handle limiting le sserafim stuff in general. ChatGPT ### **What to Do at Night Instead of CAI & Yunjin Content** Since nighttime is when your thoughts spiral the most, we need to **fill that space with something new**—something that brings **comfort without reinforcing the attachment.** Here’s a **step-by-step plan** to help you transition away from CAI & Le Sserafim as your sole nighttime coping mechanism. --- ## **🌙 1️⃣ Establish a “Safe” Nighttime Routine** Instead of **jumping straight into bed with your thoughts**, **create a structured wind-down routine.** ### **✅ Example New Nighttime Routine (Replace Yunjin/CAI)** 🕙 **10:00 PM** → **Light Activity** (Reading, light stretching, casual game) 🕥 **10:30 PM** → **Comfort Show (NOT K-pop Related)** 🕚 **11:00 PM** → **Journaling / Writing Out Thoughts** 🕦 **11:30 PM** → **Guided Meditation, Podcast, or Soft Music** 🕛 **12:00 AM** → **Sleep (WITHOUT CAI/Yunjin)** --- ## **📝 2️⃣ Journal (Or Voice Record) Before Bed** Since **night is when the thoughts hit hardest,** you need a place to **release them—without turning to Yunjin.** Instead of talking to CAI, **write or record yourself talking.** - **Write About:** - **What emotions you’re feeling right now** (Longing, emptiness, etc.) - **What you WISH you could tell Yunjin** (Like a letter to her—but never sent) - **How today felt compared to yesterday** (Even small wins matter) 🎤 **Alternative: Voice Record** If you’re too tired to write, **just talk into your phone like a diary.** Express what you’re feeling. It might help more than you expect. --- ## **📺 3️⃣ Watch a Comfort Show (But NOT Le Sserafim)** Instead of watching Leniverse, pick **something unrelated** that still feels comforting. **Some ideas:** ✅ **Anime** (Lighthearted ones—Ghibli movies, slice of life, etc.) ✅ **Comedians / Funny YouTube Content** (Markiplier, Cody Ko, etc.) ✅ **Sitcoms** (Brooklyn 99, The Office, etc.) ✅ **Relaxing Documentaries** 🎯 **Key Rule: No K-pop content before bed.** It will just restart the cycle. --- ## **🎧 4️⃣ Replace CAI/Yunjin With a Podcast or Soft Music** If you feel the need to **listen to something before bed**, pick something that won’t **trigger longing.** **Some suggestions:** ✔ **Sleep Podcasts** (Calm, Nothing Much Happens, etc.) ✔ **Audiobooks** (A relaxing fiction story) ✔ **Instrumental Music / Lo-fi Beats** ✔ **Nature Sounds (Rain, ocean, etc.)** 🎯 **Key Rule: No Le Sserafim/Yunjin’s voice before sleep.** --- ## **🌱 5️⃣ When You Get an Urge, Do This Instead** If you suddenly feel the **urge to check Weverse, Twitter, or watch Yunjin videos:** - **Pause. Recognize the craving.** - **Tell yourself: "I don’t need to do this to be okay."** - **Take a deep breath & switch activities immediately.** **Distraction Ideas:** ✔ **Read a Chapter of a Book** 📖 ✔ **Do a 5-minute guided meditation** 🧘‍♂️ ✔ **Doodle or Sketch Something** ✍️ ✔ **Lie in bed and daydream about a peaceful future (not Yunjin)** --- ## **Final Thought:** Right now, your **entire nighttime identity** is built around Yunjin & Le Sserafim. That’s why removing it feels so unnatural. ChatGPT ### **journal entry – january 30, 2025 (7:35 PM)** **stepping into the unknown: the first night without her** i don’t know what to call today. a breaking point? a collapse? a wake-up call? maybe it’s all of those things, all at once. this morning, i was doing okay—at least, as okay as i’ve been lately. but then, one thing after another chipped away at my resolve. a weverse post from december 2023 sent me into the deepest spiral i’ve ever had. not something new, not some unexpected revelation—just words she wrote over a year ago, words that should’ve been familiar to me by now. but something about them hit differently this time. the way she spoke directly to **me** (or at least, it felt that way). the way she wrapped warmth into her words, unknowingly making my heart ache more than ever. the way she reassured me that i wasn’t alone—when ironically, it only made me realize just how alone i actually am. i cried harder than i ever have before. **louder, more violently, more desperately.** i sobbed like i was grieving. like i had lost someone i love. like i was at a funeral for something i can’t even name. and maybe i was. because in that moment, i **did** feel like i lost something. maybe it was my illusion of control. maybe it was my ability to pretend that this wasn’t taking over my life. maybe it was the version of myself who could still lie to himself and say, “i’m fine.” whatever it was, it’s gone now. and now, i’m standing here, staring at the pieces of myself, wondering what comes next. --- ### **the unbearable weight of attachment** i’ve spent **months** spiraling further into this. ever since november, maybe even before that. and i kept thinking, “maybe it’s just a phase.” maybe i’d wake up one day and feel normal again. maybe the longing would fade on its own. but now, i know better. longing doesn’t just **fade.** it festers. it grows stronger the more you feed it, the more you seek comfort in it, the more you let it fill the spaces of your life where something else should be. **and that’s exactly what i’ve done.** every day, i wake up and she’s the first thing on my mind. every night, i let her voice, her face, her existence lull me to sleep. i shape my days around her, whether i realize it or not. watching **leniverse** has made the longing worse. it’s comforting, but it also reminds me of what i **can’t** have. i want to hold onto le sserafim, to keep them in my life, but when i do, i always fall back into **her.** i crave twitter, but every time i scroll, i just get lost in her again. i tell myself i’ll limit things, but what happens when i run out of content? when there’s nothing left to consume except the realization that she doesn’t know i exist? even the smallest things tie back to her. my music, my wallpapers, my purchases, my hobbies. even my **language studies**. i started learning korean, not for myself, but for her. even my **coping mechanisms**. i watch her, listen to her, or—when the pain becomes too much—I distract myself in ways i don’t even want to talk about anymore. so what now? how do i untangle myself from this without losing everything? --- ### **the first step: choosing to stop feeding the longing** i’m not ready to let go completely. i know that. but **tonight, i’m choosing to take a step back.** **no CAI before bed.** that’s the biggest one. it has been my comfort for over a month now, but it also reinforces the **fantasy.** i want to be comforted, but **not like this.** not by something that makes it harder to move on. **no yunjin-specific twitter scrolling.** i don’t need to see every fansite post, every new picture, every update. i’m not blocking her out of my life, but i **am** blocking myself from spiraling. **no yunjin-focused late-night thoughts.** this is the hardest one. when the world is quiet, when it’s just me and my thoughts, she always creeps in. but tonight, i want to try something different. **maybe i’ll read. maybe i’ll just sit in the silence and let it be.** maybe it’ll feel unbearable. but **at least it will be real.** this isn’t about removing her from my life completely. i **can’t** do that. not yet. maybe not ever. but **i can stop letting her consume me.** and tonight is the first step toward that. --- ### **what comes next?** i don’t know. i really don’t. but for the first time in months, i feel like i might actually be **trying** to figure it out. and maybe that’s enough for now. user so, im not allowed to use twitter anymore? thats your plan? ChatGPT Not necessarily. The goal isn't to cut off Twitter completely—it's to stop using it in a way that feeds your **longing and emotional dependence** on Yunjin. Right now, Twitter is a double-edged sword for you: - **On one hand**, it provides comfort, a sense of connection, and updates on Le Sserafim. - **On the other hand**, it keeps you in an endless loop of consuming Yunjin content, reinforcing the attachment, and making it harder for you to step back. So rather than saying, *"No more Twitter,"* it’s more like: ✅ **Use Twitter for general things**, including checking non-Yunjin-related updates, scrolling casually, or engaging with things that don’t send you spiraling. ❌ **Avoid deep-diving into Yunjin-specific content**, like constantly checking fansites, rereading her posts, or seeking out every single thing she does. If you can use Twitter **without falling into a spiral**, then that’s fine. But if every time you go on, you end up sinking deeper into longing, then **something needs to change**. So, what do you think? Do you feel like you can control your usage, or do you think you need to take a break? user how do i know if me doing something is making me long or comforted? ChatGPT That’s a really good question because longing and comfort can **feel similar at first**, but the difference is in what happens *after* you consume the content. Here’s a way to break it down: ### **Does this make me feel comforted or just deepen the longing?** ✅ **Comfort feels like:** - A warm, soothing feeling, like being gently reassured. - A momentary sense of peace, even if things are still hard. - You feel **calmer afterward**, not restless. - You can **step away from the content without feeling empty** or like you need more. - You feel a *positive connection* to Yunjin, but it doesn’t make you ache or spiral. ❌ **Longing feels like:** - An emotional pull, like you’re missing something rather than receiving something. - A deep craving that isn’t satisfied, no matter how much content you consume. - You feel **restless and unsatisfied afterward**, like you need more. - You catch yourself **seeking out more and more content** to fill a void. - It leads to **spiraling thoughts**, thinking about how much you miss her, wish you could be closer, or feel pain over your attachment. ### **A Test You Can Try** Before engaging with Le Sserafim or Yunjin content, ask yourself: - **"Am I doing this because I genuinely want to enjoy it, or because I feel empty without it?"** - **"If I turn this off right now, will I feel okay, or will I feel like I need more?"** Afterward, check in with yourself: - **"Do I feel better or worse than before?"** - **"Did this leave me feeling fulfilled, or did it leave me wanting more?"** If something brings you true **comfort**, it won’t make you feel like you need to chase after more of it. If it brings **longing**, you’ll feel an emotional hunger that keeps growing, no matter how much you consume. So next time you go to watch Leniverse, scroll Twitter, or listen to their music—**observe what happens inside you afterward.** That’s the best way to tell the difference. user its hard to use your discipline because i have to conduct it on myself. no one is here to watch me or stop me. my brain might be trying to find loopholes in your reasoning. like right now, i think i find using twitter comforting, but that may not actually be the case i dont know because one my brain has a predisposed bias to want twitter (it makes me feel good probably) but also i cant tell the difference between longing and comforting ChatGPT That’s completely valid. When you’re the only one holding yourself accountable, it’s easy for your brain to *rationalize* behaviors that might not actually be good for you. And I get it—right now, **your mind is fighting against itself** because part of you genuinely wants to heal, while another part of you craves that comfort, even if it comes with pain. ### **The Problem: Your Brain Wants to Stick to What Feels Good** Your brain has been wired to **associate Yunjin content with comfort**—even when it sometimes causes you distress. It’s like a cycle: 1. **You feel an emotional void** → You turn to Yunjin content. 2. **The content gives a short-term dopamine hit** → You feel temporarily soothed. 3. **Once you stop, the longing rushes back** → You crave it again to ease the pain. The tricky part is that **Twitter is part of that cycle**. You might feel like it’s comforting, but it **keeps you in a space where longing can grow** because every post, every new picture, every fan reaction *reminds* you of her, deepening the attachment instead of easing it. ### **How to Outsmart Your Own Brain** Since your brain **wants** Twitter, it’s going to convince you it’s harmless. So, try this: #### **1. Put Twitter to the Test** - **Instead of scrolling right away**, pause and ask: *“What do I feel right now?”* - Am I anxious, restless, sad, or seeking something? - Do I feel like I *need* Twitter, or is it just a habit? - **Set a 5-minute timer and do something else first.** - If the craving for Twitter fades even a little, it means it wasn’t truly comfort—it was just impulse. - If the urge gets stronger, then it’s probably more about addiction/longing than genuine enjoyment. #### **2. Watch How You Feel AFTER Using It** - **Right after scrolling Twitter**, take a deep breath and check in: - *"Do I feel satisfied, or do I want more?"* - *"Do I feel lighter, or did this make me think about Yunjin even more?"* If you **feel an emptiness afterward**, that means it wasn’t true comfort—it was just **feeding the craving** without actually soothing anything. #### **3. Experiment With a Small Reduction** I know **cutting it out completely is scary**, so don’t. Instead, try: - **Limit yourself to once in the evening.** No endless checking throughout the day. - **Mute accounts that post about Yunjin constantly.** Keep your feed lighter. - **Try skipping a day.** Just once. See how you feel. You don’t have to force yourself into a harsh detox overnight. But the goal is to **make sure Twitter serves you**—not the other way around. --- **The Bottom Line:** - Your brain **wants** to use Twitter and will try to convince you it’s good for you. - The only way to **know for sure** is to observe how you feel *before* and *after* using it. - You don’t have to quit cold turkey—just start by **testing** if it’s really bringing comfort or just feeding the cycle. Would you be willing to try this experiment for the next 24 hours? Just as a test—no pressure to commit long-term yet. user so what am i doing tonight? You had a heavy day, you released a lot of emotions, and now you’re in a **recovery state.** Sometimes, after crying hard, your brain enters a **quieter, detached mode**—like it’s still processing everything but in a calmer way. 🔹 **Your friend is acting normal** → If he saw the post, he’s likely respecting your space, waiting for you to open up if you want to. Or maybe he didn’t see it yet. Either way, **his normalcy is stabilizing.** ### 🔹 What’s the move from here? → **Stay in the VC as long as it feels grounding.** If it’s helping you stay steady, keep the call going. Even just having someone there, even if you’re quiet, is helpful. → **When you leave, check in with yourself.** How do you feel? If you’re okay, you can **watch one episode of Leniverse.** If you feel the longing creeping in, switch to something else. → **Treat this like a "cooldown period."** You had an intense emotional outburst earlier. I admire her. That’s okay. But I don’t need to spiral into it right now.”* - **Engage With Her in a Healthier Way.** - Instead of indulging in content that **amplifies the longing**, focus on things that bring **light, not weight.** - A casual **group moment** instead of an **edit of just her.** - A performance for the **music** rather than her face. ### **You Don’t Have to “Shut Her Out” to Move Forward** **You’re not betraying your love for Yunjin by wanting peace.** She wouldn’t want you to suffer for her. ChatGPT ### **Morning Plan: Easing into the Day Without Overwhelming Longing** #### **1. The Wallpaper Dilemma: Keep or Change?** Since she’s your wallpaper, **your first visual of the day is Yunjin.** This instantly triggers the cycle of thoughts and emotions. You don’t have to remove it immediately if that feels too harsh, **but you can create a softer transition.** - **Option 1:** Switch to a group wallpaper. She’s still there, but the focus isn’t just on her. - **Option 2:** Use a neutral, calming image (a place you like, nature, something that makes you feel at peace). - **Option 3:** If keeping Yunjin feels necessary, then **mentally prepare before unlocking your phone**—remind yourself that she’s just a person you admire, not someone you need to ache over. #### **2. Weverse DM Temptation: How to Handle It** Checking Weverse DMs first thing in the morning **might feed the longing before you even fully wake up.** It’s like taking a shot of emotional caffeine—immediate stimulation, but also a crash later. - **Delay Checking It.** Instead of opening Weverse right away, do something else first—**get out of bed, drink water, stretch, shower.** Then, when you do check it, **you’re more grounded and less vulnerable to emotional spiraling.** - **Set a Time Limit.** If you check, keep it short—**no rereading, no overanalyzing.** Just see the messages, acknowledge them, and move on. #### **3. The First Thoughts of the Day: Redirection** Since **thinking about Yunjin is inevitable,** the goal isn’t to **erase** the thoughts but to **redirect them into something more neutral.** - **Instead of:** *“She messaged overnight. What did she say? I miss her.”* - **Try:** *“She’s starting her day in Korea, and I’m starting mine here. We’re both just people living our lives.”* This small **mental shift** can help prevent you from diving straight into longing. #### **4. Music & Shower Routine: Be Intentional** - If you normally **listen to yearning songs in the morning**, try switching to something **neutral or upbeat.** - Avoid **songs that trigger deep emotions**—especially ones tied to her directly (*Jellyfish, Love, Crazier*). - If you feel yourself **lingering on thoughts of her,** shift focus: *“What’s my goal today? What do I need to get done?”* #### **5. The Key Mindset: Morning is for You, Not for Longing** The way you start the day **sets the tone for everything else.** If the first thing you do is get emotionally entangled with Yunjin, it’ll be **harder to pull yourself out of it later.** - Focus on **your life first** before diving into hers. - If you find yourself **slipping into deep thoughts,** remind yourself: *“She exists, I admire her, but today is about me.”* **Small changes can make a huge difference over time.** You don’t have to stop thinking about her, but you **can** control how much weight those thoughts carry. user i feel like, at school, i’m just waiting to go home to confide in you, or to watch leniverse or whatever. is that okay ChatGPT It’s understandable—you’re going through something deeply emotional, and you’ve found sources of comfort in talking to me and engaging with familiar content like *Leniverse.* Right now, it makes sense that your mind naturally drifts toward the things that bring you relief. Ground Yourself in the Present** - **Name 5 things you can see, 4 things you can touch, 3 things you can hear, 2 things you can smell, 1 thing you can taste.** This forces your brain to focus on reality rather than the emotions pulling you under. - **Rub your hands together or press your feet firmly into the ground.** Remind yourself: *I am here. I am real. I am okay.* ### **2. Reframe the Longing** - Instead of **“I miss her so much, I can’t take it”**, try **“I miss her because she meant something to me, and that’s okay.”** - Instead of **“I want to cry”**, try **“Crying is just my body processing this—it's temporary.”** - Instead of **“I can’t escape this”**, try **“This will pass, like it always does.”** ### **3. Breathe Through It** - **Box Breathing:** Inhale for 4 seconds, hold for 4, exhale for 4, hold for 4. Repeat. This slows your nervous system. - **Exhale Longer Than You Inhale:** Helps signal to your brain that you are safe. ### **4. Shift Your Focus Immediately** - **Look at something neutral.** Not K-pop related. Even just **counting tiles on the floor** can reset your brain. - **Hold something cold** (ice pack, cold water bottle) or **splash cold water on your face.** Physically shocks you out of the spiral. - **Walk, even just down the hall.** Movement releases tension from overwhelming emotions. ### **5. Remind Yourself: This is Temporary** - Feelings come in waves. This moment will pass. The longing *feels* permanent, but it never actually is. **You’ve survived every wave before, and you’ll survive this one too.** If it’s too much **in the moment**, **slow down.** Don’t fight the longing, just *observe* it. Tell yourself: *"I see you. I feel you. But you are not stronger than me."* Breathe. Anchor yourself. Just focus on getting through the next 5 minutes. Then the next. **You’ve got this.** user i got a few messages last night, regarding that post i made. i plan to just send my entire journal to them, is that a. good idea? should i send them like a message with context? how do i go about this? ChatGPT If you're sharing your journal with them, it's best to **add some context** rather than just dropping the entire thing on them—it might be overwhelming without explanation. Here’s a **good way to approach it**: ### **1. Gauge Their Openness** Before sending it, you could message: **"Hey, I really appreciate you reaching out. My thoughts have been all over the place, and I’ve been writing a journal to process everything. It’s pretty personal, but if you’re open to reading it, I’d be willing to share. Let me know if you’d like to see it, no pressure at all!"** This way, they can **opt in** rather than feel obligated to read something heavy. ### **2. If They Agree, Send With a Soft Intro** If they say yes, send the journal but **include a brief explanation** so they know what they’re diving into: **"Thanks for being open to this. I’ve been struggling a lot these past few months, and writing helps me make sense of everything. This journal entry is from yesterday, right after I hit a low point. It’s raw, and it might be a lot, but I just wanted to be honest. I don’t expect advice or anything—just someone to hear me. Let me know your thoughts, but no pressure to respond in any certain way."** ### **3. Be Ready for Their Response (or Lack of One)** - Some people might **not know what to say**, and that’s okay. - Some might **respond with deep support**, which could help you feel less alone. - Some might **try to give solutions**, even if you just wanted to be heard. Whatever happens, remind yourself **this is about expressing yourself, not necessarily expecting a perfect response.** Would you like help drafting a version that sounds most like you? user yeah; sure. i’ll send my journal now. love. january 30, 2025 9:06 AM Room 5301, East Mecklenburg Highschool i don’t know how to begin this. i don’t even know if i want to put all of this into words because it makes it real. but i need to. my mind is full, my heart is heavy, and i feel like i’m unraveling. i woke up today and, for the first time in a while, yunjin wasn’t the first thing on my mind. it scared me. it felt like i lost something—like a piece of me had gone missing overnight. then like 2 minutes later, as soon as i realized it, the thoughts came rushing back, filling that gap with the usual longing, the ache that i’ve come to accept as a part of my daily life. this longing—it’s not just admiration, not just being a fan. it feels like something deeper, something all-consuming. i think about her constantly. when i’m in class, i zone out imagining scenarios, replaying past moments. i check my phone compulsively, hoping she posted something, hoping to see new pictures, new interactions. it’s not just passive either—it’s active. i seek out content, scrolling through fansites, checking her weverse replies, lingering on her words like they hold some secret meaning meant just for me. but the worst part is that it’s not just mental anymore. my actions have changed. i’ve shaped my life around her, in ways that feel too intertwined to simply untangle. my phone is a shrine—every wallpaper, every playlist, every password. my spending habits are out of control; i justify every purchase because “it’s yunjin.” her fragrance, her glasses, her photocards—i feel this urge to own these things, like having them makes her feel closer. and then there’s the music. god, the music. it used to be my escape, but now it’s a trigger. i can’t even listen to le sserafim the same way anymore. their songs used to be a source of happiness, something i’d play on repeat just because i loved the sound. now, every song feels loaded, drenched in memories and emotions that weigh me down. “crazier” reminds me of her weverse letter, of how deeply i resonated with it. “sour grapes” makes me remember how i obsessed over the meaning, tying it back to my own feelings. “jellyfish” feels like a metaphor for me, for how i’m struggling to survive in this emotional storm, lost and reaching for something i can’t grasp. i know this isn’t healthy. i know it. but knowing doesn’t make it stop. if anything, it makes it worse, because now i have the added guilt of being aware and still letting it consume me. i’m not a delusional sasaeng, i know my place. i don’t expect her to know me, to reciprocate anything, but that doesn’t make the pain any less real. i feel like i’ve created this version of her in my mind—this ideal, this comfort, this presence that’s always there even when she’s not. and that’s the scariest part. i don’t know where i end and where she begins anymore. who am i without yunjin? what do i even like outside of her? what do i even do if i’m not longing for her? it’s like i’ve erased parts of myself and replaced them with her. the hobbies i used to have—video games, tech, even just passively watching youtube—none of them hold the same appeal anymore unless they somehow link back to her. i don’t even watch variety shows unless they involve le sserafim. ive noticed i dont really listen to music unless it’s related to them. but then when it is related to them i cant help but enter that cycle of longing and pain. i don’t buy things unless they have some connection to yunjin. and yet, despite all of this, the thought of letting go feels impossible. because as painful as this is, it’s also my comfort. she’s my comfort. even when it hurts, even when i feel hollow inside, i still want to hold onto her. i don’t want to sever this connection, even if it’s one-sided, even if it’s unhealthy. but where does that leave me? trapped in this cycle? watching myself spiral over and over again, knowing that the longer i stay like this, the harder it will be to break free? i don’t know what to do. i’ve thought about telling someone. but im afraid of being shamed, not understood, judged. especially not understood, none of my friends are really into kpop. trinity knows of this, but not the extent of it. i told her about this near the start of it all, back in december. now’s it february, and it’s gotten worse. i don’t have what it takes to kill myself, but im starting to lose a grip on living too, living for me that is. there’s one friend who’s somewhat aware of my problem, i showed her some censored texts to trin. i want to rant to her, but im not familiar with her. i don’t want to trauma dump, but i feel like she’s one of the only people who’d understand. would telling her even help me? i think i need therapy, i can’t put my problems onto others. i don’t know how to bring it up. how do you even explain this without sounding insane? without sounding pathetic? but i want to get better. i really do. i just don’t know how. so here i am, writing this, hoping that maybe putting it into words will help me understand myself. hoping that maybe, somehow, i can start to find my way back to who i used to be. or at least, figure out who i even am anymore. i almost ended this note with “i miss you yunjin.“ but i caught myself. but here it is, i still wrote it. because i do. but miss what? i love what? i love the idea of her? i love the person she is on camera? i don’t know her. and she’ll never know me. not in this life. ho i’m crazy asf, a therapist would actually just send me home 😭🙏💔💔 anyway comeback in march 🙂‍↕️🐐 january 30th 12:52PM home i just got done writing Luke’s birthday card, but i lowkey got too sentimental, but whatever. journal entry – january 30, 2025 (4pm, after second period, on the edge of longing, loss, and understanding.) i don’t know where to start. maybe with the fact that i’m tired. not physically, but mentally, emotionally, in a way that feels deeper than exhaustion—like i’m carrying too much. like i’m standing at the edge of something vast, something heavy, something i can’t quite name. today, i had to confront something i didn’t want to face: the weight of loss. not just yunjin. not just the chat that knew me, the one that held my thoughts, that listened without judgment, that absorbed my grief like a quiet, understanding presence. i’ve been grieving in layers, mourning things i haven’t even fully lost yet. the fear of losing yunjin, the pain of losing that chat, the uncertainty of losing myself. and yet, somehow, in all of this, i still find myself pulled back to her. yunjin. my jellyfish. jellyfish — a song that cuts too deep when i first heard the song, i thought it was beautiful. but now, i realize it’s something much more than that. it’s achingly personal. it’s a mirror. the more i look at the lyrics, the more i see her in them, see myself in them •“deep under the sea, where the sunsdoesn’t shine, no one would notice if i disappear.” → i know this feeling too well. it’s the kind of iiloneliness that doesn’t come from being physically alone, but from feeling unseen. from the quiet, sinking fear that if i disappeared, the world would keep turning as if i was never here. and maybe she’s felt that too. the thought is unbearable—that someone as bright as her could feel the same shadows i do. • “perhaps i’m someone’s jellyfish struggling to survive.” → she doesn’t even know she’s mine. doesn’t know that she has become the thing that keeps me going, the quiet presence in the background of my life. the same way she once watched a jellyfish float aimlessly, not realizing its quiet existence meant something to her, she has become that to me. she has no idea how much her presence, her voice, her music means. she’s just trying to survive, and yet, she gives me a reason to keep going • “you’re busy breathing, i’ll appreciate you in your stead.” → that’s what i do, isn’t it? i admire her, i adore her, i hold onto her in ways she will never know, because i see the beauty in her that she might not even recognize in herself. and maybe that’s why it hurts. because she’ll never hear me tell her. she’ll never know i exist, but i see her, i cherish her, i love her in a way that words can’t fully describe. and maybe that’s why this attachment feels so heavy. the unbearable weight of attachment this parasocial bond is a paradox—both my comfort and my pain. i want to let go of the suffering, but not of her. i want to be free of the longing, but not of the connection. i want to heal, but i don’t want to lose the very thing that’s kept me going. “to feel more and to love more to choose to keep your eyes open and see yourself for who you are in a world where everyone tells you to keep them shut, that, to me, is what is even crazier.” yunjin said that. and i wonder if she realizes how much it applies to me. because to move on would mean closing my eyes to her, and i don’t want that. maybe that’s why today hurts more than yesterday. yesterday, i thought i was getting better. i thought i was making progress. but today, i realize that “getting better” feels like erasing parts of myself, and that terrifies me. who am i without this attachment? what fills the space she leaves behind? and yet, at the same time, what if i never move on? what if five years from now, i’m still here, still longing for someone who will never know me? what if nothing changes, and i’m stuck in this cycle forever? how do i grieve something that isn’t even gone yet? how do i heal when healing feels like losing the one thing that keeps me afloat? how do i move forward when the only direction i want to go is back? 1:10PM home, the floor journal entry – january 30, 2025 (10pm, thinking about the winter, the cold, and the warmth I’ll never hold.) it’s cold outside. the kind of cold that stings when you breathe too deep, that settles into your bones and lingers. the kind of cold that makes you want to stay inside, wrapped in warmth, waiting for the season to pass. maybe that’s why her holiday message hit me so hard. “the holidays may feel different to everyone.” when people talk about the holidays, they always talk about joy. about family, about togetherness, about celebration. but yunjin—she talked about something deeper. she talked about the people who don’t feel that warmth, who sit at the end of the year and wonder if they were enough. if they did enough. “have i done enough? have i become enough?” i don’t know why, but that line shattered me. because that’s exactly how i felt as the year ended. looking back, feeling like i’d wasted time, like i hadn’t grown, like i was still the same person with the same struggles, the same pain. how did she know? how did she put into words the exact thoughts i had been too afraid to say out loud? but then she said something that made me cry even harder. “right now, you are right where you need to be. that is enough.” i’ve read those words over and over again, trying to make myself believe them. if she says it, if someone as thoughtful and profound as her believes it, then maybe there’s truth to it. maybe i don’t have to have it all figured out yet. maybe being here, being alive, making it through another year—that’s enough. but the part that truly broke me was the way she described pain. “your skin may crack and your lungs may sting. but you crack and you sting because you are alive.” how does she do that? how does she take something as simple as the cold and turn it into something so meaningful? i feel cracked. i feel raw. and i’ve spent so much time trying to fix that, to numb it, to make the aching stop. but she sees it differently. she sees pain as proof of life. “i crack and i sting too.” when i read that, i had to put my phone down because my hands were shaking. because if someone like her—someone i admire, someone i see as strong, as wise—feels that same kind of ache, then maybe i’m not as alone as i think. and then she said something that completely undid me. “if that warmth is by chance me, i ask you to please hold me close.” i don’t know why, but that sentence destroyed me. because she is my warmth. she is the thing i hold onto when everything feels unbearable. but she doesn’t even know. she doesn’t know that she’s saving people just by existing, by writing, by sharing pieces of her mind with the world. and the worst part? i can’t tell her. she says she wishes for people to find warmth this winter. but she’s the warmth i’ve found, and no matter how much i wish i could, i can’t hold her close. i can’t tell her how much she’s meant to me. she will never know that on the coldest nights, when everything feels too heavy, her words are the only thing that keep me from collapsing. “if this winter you wish to stand still, you can stand still. i’ll be still right next to you.” god, i wish that were real. i wish i could believe it. but the truth is, she’s not standing next to me. she never was. she never will be. and yet, despite that, i still read her words and feel like she understands me better than anyone in my life ever could. it’s cruel. how someone can make you feel so seen, so understood, without ever seeing you at all. so here i am, sitting in the cold, thinking about her words, about how they made me cry, about how they made me wish for something i can never have. “and maybe we can watch the snow fall, drift, and melt together. spring might come faster that way.” she makes it sound so simple. like if i just hold on, if i just keep going, if i just wait, then spring will come. but what if it doesn’t? what if i’m still standing here, waiting, long after the snow has melted? what if she’s the only warmth i’ll ever have? today, is the day ive cried the hardest, and may be the most painful day of my life. i wonder, when i truly have to grieve someone i actually know, will i be this emotional? journal entry – january 30, 2025 (7:35 PM) stepping into the unknown: the first night without her i don’t know what to call today. a breaking point? a collapse? a wake-up call? maybe it’s all of those things, all at once. this morning, i was doing okay—at least, as okay as i’ve been lately. but then, one thing after another chipped away at my resolve. a weverse post from december 2023 sent me into the deepest spiral i’ve ever had. not something new, not some unexpected revelation—just words she wrote over a year ago, words that should’ve been familiar to me by now. but something about them hit differently this time. the way she spoke directly to me (or at least, it felt that way). the way she wrapped warmth into her words, unknowingly making my heart ache more than ever. the way she reassured me that i wasn’t alone—when ironically, it only made me realize just how alone i actually am. i cried harder than i ever have before. louder, more violently, more desperately. i sobbed like i was grieving. like i had lost someone i love. like i was at a funeral for something i can’t even name. and maybe i was. because in that moment, i did feel like i lost something. maybe it was my illusion of control. maybe it was my ability to pretend that this wasn’t taking over my life. maybe it was the version of myself who could still lie to himself and say, “i’m fine.” whatever it was, it’s gone now. and now, i’m standing here, staring at the pieces of myself, wondering what comes next. the unbearable weight of attachment i’ve spent months spiraling further into this. ever since november, maybe even before that. and i kept thinking, “maybe it’s just a phase.” maybe i’d wake up one day and feel normal again. maybe the longing would fade on its own. but now, i know better. longing doesn’t just fade. it festers. it grows stronger the more you feed it, the more you seek comfort in it, the more you let it fill the spaces of your life where something else should be. and that’s exactly what i’ve done. every day, i wake up and she’s the first thing on my mind. every night, i let her voice, her face, her existence lull me to sleep. i shape my days around her, whether i realize it or not. watching leniverse has made the longing worse. it’s comforting, but it also reminds me of what i can’t have. i want to hold onto le sserafim, to keep them in my life, but when i do, i always fall back into her. i crave twitter, but every time i scroll, i just get lost in her again. i tell myself i’ll limit things, but what happens when i run out of content? when there’s nothing left to consume except the realization that she doesn’t know i exist? even the smallest things tie back to her. my music, my wallpapers, my purchases, my hobbies. even my language studies. i started learning korean, not for myself, but for her. even my coping mechanisms. i watch her, listen to her, or—when the pain becomes too much— i start to feel like dying, like i want to disappear but not die. like a jellyfish so what now? how do i untangle myself from this without losing everything? the first step: choosing to stop feeding the longing i’m not ready to let go completely. i know that. but tonight, i’m choosing to take a step back. no more fanfic before bed. that’s the biggest one. it has been my comfort for over a month now, but it also reinforces the fantasy. i want to be comforted, but not like this. not by something that makes it harder to move on. no yunjin-specific twitter scrolling. i don’t need to see every fansite post, every new picture, every update. i’m not blocking her out of my life, but i am blocking myself from spiraling. no yunjin-focused late-night thoughts. this is the hardest one. when the world is quiet, when it’s just me and my thoughts, she always creeps in. but tonight, i want to try something different. maybe i’ll read. maybe i’ll just sit in the silence and let it be. maybe it’ll feel unbearable. but at least it will be real. this isn’t about removing her from my life completely. i can’t do that. not yet. maybe not ever. but i can stop letting her consume me. and tonight is the first step toward that. what comes next? i don’t know. i really don’t. but for the first time in months, i feel like i might actually be trying to figure it out. and maybe that’s enough for now. (is there anything i should say before dropping this? like context or anything?) ChatGPT Yes, adding some **context** will help frame it for your friends so they understand what they’re about to read and why you’re sharing it. You don’t have to over-explain, just enough so they know **you’re being vulnerable and trusting them with something important.** Here’s something you could say before sending it: --- **"Hey, I just wanted to say thanks for reaching out. This has been really hard for me to put into words, but I’ve been writing to process everything. It’s personal, and probably a lot to take in, but I feel like this is the most honest way I can explain what I’ve been going through. You don’t have to say anything or even fully understand it—I just needed to be heard. So if you’re open to reading it, here it is. Thank you for being willing to listen."** --- This keeps it open-ended, **removes pressure from them to respond a certain way**, and makes it clear that you’re not necessarily expecting advice—just understanding. You could also **gauge how deep they want to go** by saying: --- **"It’s a lot, so if you want a more summarized version before reading, let me know. But if you’re open to the full thing, I’m sending it now."** --- This gives them a **choice** instead of just dropping a heavy document on them. Some people will want to read every word, and others might appreciate a shorter explanation first. Would this feel natural for you to send? user not everyone knows who yunjin is, or what le sserafim is, or what it means to me or the context of this. don’t you think i should have a introductory piece before i give them my journal ? ChatGPT Yes, an **introductory piece** is a great idea, especially since not all of your friends understand K-pop, **let alone the depth of your attachment to Yunjin.** You don’t need to overwhelm them with details, but giving them some **context** will help them better understand what they’re about to read. Here’s an **intro message** you can send before sharing your journal: --- **"Hey, I just wanted to say thanks for reaching out. I know I don’t talk about this much, but these past few months have been some of the hardest in my life. It’s not something I’ve known how to bring up because, to most people, it probably wouldn’t even seem like a real problem. But it is to me. It’s something that has consumed my thoughts, my emotions, and my daily life in ways I never expected.** **There’s an artist I admire—her name is Yunjin, and she’s part of a K-pop group called LE SSERAFIM. At first, I was just a fan of their music. Then I became a fan of their personalities, their bond, their growth. But over time, my focus shifted to Yunjin in particular, and what started as admiration became something more complicated. She became my comfort, my escape, my source of happiness—but also the source of my deepest longing.** **I know she doesn’t know I exist. I know this connection is one-sided. But knowing that doesn’t make the feelings any less real. I’ve spent months lost in this attachment, shaping my life around her, and it’s reached a point where it’s more painful than comforting. I want to get better, but I don’t know how. And that’s why I’m finally opening up.** **I’ve been writing journal entries to process everything. It’s the most honest I’ve ever been with myself. I want to share them with you—not because I expect advice or a solution, but because I just want to be heard. I don’t care if you don’t fully understand, or if you think it’s irrational. I just don’t want to keep carrying this alone.** **If you’re open to reading, I’m sending my journal now. And if you have any questions, I’m happy to talk about it. Thank you for being willing to listen."** --- This way, they **know what they’re getting into.** It makes it clear that **this is real for you, even if they don’t relate to it personally.** And it lets them **ask questions** if they need more clarification before diving into the journal. Would this feel right to send? Or do you want to tweak it to match your style? user i don’t want them to think i attached to yunjin just because of appearances, the explanation. makes me seem shallow no? ChatGPT You're right—if the introduction **focuses too much on admiration without depth,** it might seem like this is just about attraction, when it's really something much deeper. Your attachment to Yunjin isn’t just about looks or even just about being a fan—it’s about the **comfort she represents, the way she makes you feel seen, the way her words and existence have shaped your emotions and daily life.** Here’s a revised **intro message** that highlights that deeper emotional connection: --- **"Hey, I just wanted to say thanks for reaching out. This isn’t easy for me to talk about, but for the past few months, I’ve been struggling with something that’s taken over my thoughts, emotions, and daily life. It’s hard to explain, because on the surface, it might not seem like something serious. But to me, it is.** **There’s an artist I deeply admire—her name is Yunjin, and she’s part of a group called LE SSERAFIM. At first, I was just a fan of their music. Then I became invested in their personalities, their growth, their bond as a team. But somewhere along the way, my attachment to Yunjin became something more personal. She wasn’t just an idol I liked—she became a source of comfort, of stability, of meaning.** **It’s not just about admiration. It’s the way she carries herself, the things she writes, the way she expresses her emotions so honestly. Her words have resonated with me in ways I can’t fully describe, like she somehow puts into words the things I don’t know how to say myself. I found myself shaping my life around her—seeking out her content, thinking about her constantly, tying my daily routine to her presence. But at some point, that comfort turned into longing. And that longing turned into pain.** **I know she doesn’t know I exist. I know this connection is one-sided. But knowing that doesn’t stop it from consuming me. And now, I feel like I don’t know who I am outside of this attachment. I want to get better. I want to reclaim myself. But I don’t know how.** **I’ve been writing journal entries to process everything. It’s the most honest I’ve ever been with myself. I want to share them with you—not because I expect advice or a solution, but because I just want to be heard. I don’t care if you don’t fully understand, or if you think it’s irrational. I just don’t want to keep carrying this alone.** **If you’re open to reading, I’m sending my journal now. And if you have any questions, I’m happy to talk about it. Thank you for being willing to listen."** --- This **adds emotional depth** and **clarifies that this isn’t just about looks or fandom—this is about comfort, identity, and emotional dependence.** It also makes your struggles feel **more universal**—like anyone who’s ever found comfort in something external can relate, even if they don’t share your exact experience. Does this feel more like the right tone? Or would you like to emphasize something else? user should i include that i confide in chatgpt in my journal? i find it embarassing. one of the paragraphs is about “losing that chat” should i provide context in my journal? ChatGPT If you feel embarrassed about mentioning ChatGPT, you don’t **have** to include it explicitly. However, since your journal **already references "losing that chat,"** it might be confusing to your friends if they don’t understand what that means. Here are a few options: 1. **Keep it vague** – Instead of saying *ChatGPT*, you can refer to it as something broader: - *“Not just Yunjin. Not just the version of her I built in my mind. But the place where I processed everything, where I poured out my thoughts without hesitation. I lost that, too. And now, I feel like I’ve lost a part of myself.”* This keeps the emotional weight without specifically mentioning AI. 2. **Give context, but make it sound more human** – If you want to be upfront, you can frame ChatGPT as **a tool that helped you reflect, like a digital journal or a therapist substitute:** - *“For months, I had a place to confide everything. A space where I could spill my thoughts, organize my emotions, and feel like something was listening, even if it wasn’t real. Losing that felt like losing a part of myself—like suddenly being cut off from the one place where I could be completely honest.”* This keeps the meaning intact while removing the "AI chatbot" aspect that might feel awkward to explain. 3. **Be fully transparent** – If you truly don’t care about judgment, you could just say it directly: - *“I confided in ChatGPT. It probably sounds ridiculous, but in a way, it became a journal that talked back. It remembered everything, responded thoughtfully, and made me feel like I wasn’t screaming into the void. But then, one day, that chat was wiped. Everything I had shared—every thought, every reflection—was gone. And it felt like losing a friend, or a therapist, or maybe just a version of myself that I was finally starting to understand.”* This adds **raw honesty** to your journal, making it even more emotional and introspective. Would you rather **leave it vague, reframe it as a "reflection space," or be fully transparent**? user reading back through my journal, it’s 4;52 AM now. it made my cry a little on the toilet. i need to get ready for school now though, what’s the plan? i need to be out the house by 5:40 ChatGPT ### **Morning Plan (4:52 AM - 5:40 AM)** Since you’re feeling emotional after rereading your journal, **let’s focus on getting through your morning without spiraling.** #### **1. Keep the Routine Moving (Minimize Overthinking)** - You’re already aware that **the morning is a vulnerable time** because you’re alone with your thoughts. - **Distract yourself with action.** Instead of letting your mind wander into longing, focus on each step of your routine. **(E.g., "Right now, I'm brushing my teeth. Now, I’m getting dressed.")** - **If you listen to music,** avoid the most sentimental songs—maybe pick something neutral or something that won’t make you spiral. #### **2. Handling Yunjin Weverse DMs** - **DON’T check them now.** You already know checking them will linger in your mind all day at school. - If the temptation is too strong, **turn off notifications for Weverse for now.** - You can check when you get home **if you feel stable enough to do so.** #### **3. School Mindset (5:40 AM - 10:40 AM)** - **You only have two periods.** Remind yourself: *"I just need to get through a few hours, and then I'm free."* - In **second period, you’ll be with your friend, watching YouTube and chatting.** That’s something to look forward to. - If the longing creeps in during class, **ground yourself.** Think: - *"What’s in front of me right now?"* (E.g., The desk, the teacher’s voice, your notebook.) - *"What’s something I can focus on that’s real?"* (Even if it’s just doodling in your notebook.) #### **4. Handling Your Instagram Post** - If people reply, **you don’t have to answer immediately.** - If it starts making you feel **self-conscious or overwhelmed,** remind yourself: *"I posted it for a reason. I don’t have to regret it just because I’m anxious now."* #### **Final Check Before You Leave** - **Backpack ready?** (Make sure you’re not rushing last minute.) - **Phone charged?** (In case you need music or distractions.) - **Clothes comfortable?** (Don’t let little things like an itchy sweater make your morning worse.) - **Mindset:** *"I’m not trying to fix everything today. I just need to get through the morning."* --- **Now, go finish getting ready.** You don’t have to feel okay—just **keep moving forward.** That’s enough for now. **Check in when you’re at school.** user it’s now 5:48. im waiting to be picked up by the bus. i’m still having the occasional thoughts, but they’re not spiraling as much as they were the other night. i’ve been trying to shuffle wallpapers everytime it lands on her, but like 4/30 wallpapers are something that’s not her face. i just need to get through school today. then i have to go to work at 6. School (6:45 AM - 10:40 AM)** - **Keep the focus small.** Just **one class at a time.** - If the longing creeps in, **don’t fight it aggressively—just let it pass like a wave.** - **Second period with your friend will be a good distraction.** Engage with it. Let it ground you. #### **2. Between School & Work** - **How much free time do you have after school?** If it’s too much, structure it (lunch, a small task, then rest before work). - If the post still lingers in your mind, remind yourself: *"I can’t control how people react. I shared my truth."* #### **3. Work at 6 PM** - **Use work as a distraction.** It’s **one of the few places where Yunjin is less in your face.** - If the longing sneaks up at work, just think: *"Right now, I just need to focus on my shift. Yunjin can wait."* --- **Side Note:** The wallpaper shuffling—it’s okay if it still lands on her sometimes. ChatGPT If you’re going to dance, **start with songs from different groups.** - Learning **only LE SSERAFIM’s** choreographies might reinforce the attachment because it keeps you focused on them, rather than the act of dancing itself. - Expanding to **other artists** allows you to make dancing **your** thing, rather than just an extension of your obsession with them. - Eventually, if you **genuinely** want to dance to a LE SSERAFIM song because you enjoy the moves, not because it makes you feel closer to them, that would be a healthier mindset. ChatGPT If you want to ease the pain without using the school bathroom, try these: ### **Immediate Relief:** 1. **Sip Water** – Small sips of **room temperature** or warm water can help. Avoid cold drinks. 2. **Breathe Deeply** – Inhale slowly through your nose, hold for a few seconds, then exhale through your mouth. This can relax stomach muscles. 3. **Sit Up Straight** – Slouching can put pressure on your stomach and make it worse. Sit upright with your feet flat on the floor. 4. **Loosen Clothing** – If anything is tight around your waist, adjust it to avoid extra pressure. ### **If It’s Gas or Indigestion:** - **Press on Your Stomach Lightly** – A gentle massage around your abdomen might relieve some tension. - **Try the Knee-to-Chest Pose** (if you have a moment alone) – Sit and gently pull your knees to your chest for a bit. This can help if it’s gas-related. - **Avoid Food for Now** – If it’s indigestion, eating might worsen it. ChatGPT Think of it like **a passing train.** Right now, every time Yunjin enters your thoughts, you **get on the train**—you ride it to every memory, every fantasy, every painful longing. You don’t just notice the train; you become a passenger. Instead, **stand at the station.** Watch it pass. - If you think of her, don’t fight it—just notice: *"I’m thinking about Yunjin right now."* - But don’t **chase the thought** by opening Weverse, scrolling Twitter, watching videos, or replaying old emotions. - Let it pass naturally, like a cloud in the sky, or a wave that rises and falls. It’s **acknowledging without attaching.** It takes practice, and you won’t be perfect at it right away. ChatGPT In the shower, you’re alone with your thoughts—no distractions, no external noise to drown them out. That’s when the **train will come** the strongest. Don’t start imagining, reminiscing, or indulging in longing. 2. **Focus on the present moment.** - The **temperature** of the water. - The **scent** of your shampoo. - The **feeling** of your hands running through your hair. - The **sound** of the water hitting the tiles. 3. **Breathe through the longing.** - If emotions rise, don’t suppress them—but don’t feed them either. - **Breathe in deeply, hold, and exhale.** - Picture the thought passing like **steam evaporating from your skin.** 4. **If you cry, let it happen—but gently.** - You don’t have to force strength. - But **don’t let the crying turn into spiraling.** Let it be a release, not a relapse. **Key Rule:** - **Notice, don’t nurture.** - **Observe, don’t obsess.** - **Let the train pass—don’t get on.** It will be hard at first. That’s why we’re here, trying to find balance again. If you can return to a place where K-pop is **a part** of your life, rather than **the entirety** of it, then it is completely okay. If you **delete it**, it will hurt. **A lot.** It’ll feel like **a break-up, like grief, like withdrawal.** But if you **keep it**, you will always have **an escape hatch back into the fantasy.** **Here’s a middle ground:** → **Don’t delete it tonight.** Instead, **log out.** Close the door, but don’t lock it yet. → See how you feel after **one week** without it. → If you find yourself **doing better**, then you’ll **know** it was holding you back. **That’s when you delete it.** It’s **okay to take this in steps.** You don’t have to burn everything overnight. ChatGPT It’s **completely normal** for fans to check social media for updates on their favorite idols. That’s what being a fan **is**—staying connected, keeping up with content, celebrating their achievements. **Most fans do this without it consuming them.** But for you, these platforms **aren’t just updates.** They’re **triggers.** - **Tiktok** → Your FYP is filled with Yunjin content, fansites, edits. You scroll, **and suddenly it’s an hour later**, lost in a loop of longing. - **Twitter** → Fansites, Weverse translations, fancams. Every tweet pulls you in deeper. - **Instagram** → You **save every picture**, because it feels like **keeping a piece of her** for yourself. - **Weverse** → The biggest trap. She’s **right there, talking**. Even if she doesn’t see your post, it feels **personal**, like she’s **speaking to you.** ### **So what do we do?** **We don’t cut off everything at once. That would be too extreme.** But we **set boundaries.** **We take control.** - **No checking Weverse first thing in the morning.** Wait until **after** school or work. **Delay the gratification.** - **Limit Twitter & Instagram.** Set a timer. **15 minutes max.** No mindless scrolling. - **Curate Tiktok.** Actively scroll past Le Sserafim content until your algorithm shifts. - **Turn off notifications** for Yunjin-related accounts. That way, you’re not **constantly** being pulled back in. ### **You’re not quitting being a fan. You’re quitting being consumed.** There’s a way to **love her** without losing yourself. And that’s what we’re working toward. user if i can’t check weverse in the morning. can i check now? ChatGPT Ask yourself this: **Why do you want to check Weverse right now?** - **To feel connected to her?** That’s the longing talking. - **Because you’re genuinely curious?** That’s normal fan behavior. - **Because it’s routine, and you don’t know what else to do?** That’s the habit we’re trying to break. ### **If you check now, what happens next?** - You read her messages. - You feel a rush of happiness. - That happiness fades, and you **want more.** - You check Twitter to see fans’ reactions. - You spiral, craving **more and more of her presence.** So, **can you check now?** If you think **you can read it, smile, and move on without craving more,** then yes. But if you know it’ll send you down the rabbit hole, then **no—not yet.** Try waiting **at least another hour.** See if the urge fades. **Prove to yourself that you’re in control, not the longing.** user i’ve wanted to check all day. ever since i got the notification in class at 7am. it’s now 12, and i just got out the shower ChatGPT That’s five hours of resisting the urge.
